title: UK Snooker Championship 2022: Neil Robertson and John Higgins beaten in first round
description: Neil Robertson and John Higgins are beaten on another day of shocks in the UK Championship first round.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo says he feels 'betrayed" by Manchester United
description: Cristiano Ronaldo says he feels "betrayed" by Manchester United and that he is being forced out of the club.

title: Suella Braverman to sign deal for expansion of measures in France to stop migrants crossing English Channel
description: The home secretary will finalise a deal with the French to try to curb Channel crossings in small boats.

title: Faisal Islam: The repair Budget to defuse a financial timebomb
description: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt's key message this week will be about restoring stability and controlling price rises.

title: How Premier League looks at World Cup break - and who could come back better
description: As the Premier League takes its World Cup break, BBC Sport looks at the state of play and who could come out flying on Boxing Day.

title: Rugby League World Cup: England no longer starstruck by New Zealand, says Tara-Jane Stanley
description: England centre Tara-Jane Stanley says they are no longer starstruck by facing the southern hemisphere giants at the Rugby League World Cup.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Tony Adams withdraws with an injury
description: Judge Shirley Ballas says the sportsman has become one of the nation's favourite entertainers.

title: World Cup 2022: Fernandes 'not happy at all' about circumstances in Qatar
description: Portugal midfielder Bruno Fernandes is "not happy" about the circumstances surrounding next month's World Cup in Qatar.

title: Sao Paulo Grand Prix: George Russell beats Lewis Hamilton to first full Formula 1 win
description: George Russell takes a maiden grand prix victory - and a first for Mercedes in 2022 - as Max Verstappen was penalised for a collision with Lewis Hamilton in Sao Paulo.

title: Fulham 1-2 Manchester United: Alejandro Garnacho scores dramatic injury-time winner
description: Manchester United snatch a dramatic winner through Alejandro Garnacho as they beat Fulham in a thrilling final Premier League match before the World Cup.

title: Donald Trump and Mitch McConnell: Republican anger over midterms
description: Donald Trump and Mitch McConnell get heat from colleagues after the Democrats keep control of the Senate.

title: My Dad Wrote A Porno: Hit podcast series to come to an end in December
description: The hosts of the podcast, downloaded more than 430m times, hint there's something else to come.

title: Gwent Police to face misogyny, corruption and racism probe
description: Gwent Police is investigated after "abhorrent" messages between serving and retired officers emerged.

title: Brighton 1-2 Aston Villa: Danny Ings claims double as Villa claim first away win
description: Danny Ings scores twice as Aston Villa beat Brighton for their first Premier League away win of the season.

title: Wheelchair Rugby League World Cup: England set up final meeting with holders France
description: England score 22 tries as they overwhelm Wales to set up a Wheelchair Rugby League World Cup final against France.

title: Scotland 23-31 New Zealand: Scots push All Blacks close but miss out on first win
description: Scotland fail to end a 117-year wait for a first ever win against New Zealand as the beleaguered All Blacks fight back to win a thriller at Murrayfield.

title: T20 World Cup: England secure legacy as an iconic team in nation's sporting history
description: In becoming double world champions by winning the 2022 T20 World Cup, England have secured their legacy as an all-time great side.

title: Hinkley Point C construction worker killed in 'traffic incident'
description: Investigations will begin after a construction worker died at the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station site.

title: Ukraine war: Kherson curfew and river ban in security crackdown
description: Ukraine moves quickly to maintain order in Kherson, facing Russian troops across the Dnipro river.

title: Istanbul: Four dead, dozens wounded in explosion
description: The blast happened in a busy shopping area in the heart of the Turkish city.

title: T20 World Cup: England beat Pakistan to win T20 World Cup
description: Watch highlights as Ben Stokes, Sam Curran and Adil Rashid star in helping England claim their second T20 World Cup title with a five-wicket victory over Pakistan in the final.

title: T20 World Cup: Ben Stokes the 'ultimate competitor' - Jos Buttler
description: Captain Jos Buttler hails Ben Stokes as the "ultimate competitor" after the all-rounder takes England to T20 World Cup glory in Melbourne.

title: Burnley 3-0 Blackburn Rovers: Clarets win East Lancashire derby to return to top of Championship
description: Two-goal Ashley Barnes and Anass Zaroury score as Burnley hammer Blackburn Rovers to return to the top of the Championship.

title: T20 World Cup: Ben Stokes and Moeen Ali take control for England after Shaheen Afridi injury
description: Watch keys moments from the T20 World Cup final as Ben Stokes and Moeen Ali capitalise on an injury to Pakistan's star bowler Shaheen Afridi to swing the match in England's favour.

title: Jeremy Hunt: Everyone will have to pay more tax
description: The chancellor also tells the BBC he wants to make sure any recession is as short and shallow as possible.

title: ‘I just felt empty after losing World Cup final’ - Brown column
description: In her final BBC Sport column of the Rugby World Cup, England prop Shaunagh Brown discusses final defeat and how she will bounce back.

title: T20 World Cup: England beat Pakistan to win pulsating final in Melbourne
description: England beat Pakistan in a pulsating final in Melbourne to win the Men's T20 World Cup and become double world champions.

title: Kherson: Inside the city liberated from the Russians
description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen reports from the city newly liberated from Russian control.

title: T20 World Cup: The moment England won second T20 World Cup title
description: Watch as Ben Stokes scores the winning run to give England their second T20 World Cup title as they beat Pakistan by five wickets in Melbourne.

title: Ros Atkins on… How Qatar got to host the World Cup
description: BBC Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at the years of corruption allegations around Fifa awarding the 2022 World Cup to Qatar.

title: The fall of the FTX ‘King of Crypto’ Sam Bankman-Fried
description: How a crypto empire built on video game battles and beanbags came crashing down.

title: Lancashire Police officer charged with attempted murder
description: A woman is in a stable condition in hospital after being injured in a Manchester hotel, police say.

title: T20 World Cup: Haris Rauf gets huge wicket of Jos Buttler for 26
description: Watch as Haris Rauf gets the huge wicket of England captain Jos Buttler for 26 at the T20 World Cup final in Melbourne.

title: David Moyes: West Ham still backing manager despite three successive league defeats
description: West Ham are backing manager David Moyes to pull them out of their current slump in form.

title: T20 World Cup: England's Sam Curran takes 3-12 against Pakistan in final
description: Sam Curran picks up the wickets of Mohammad Rizwan, Shan Masood and Mohammad Nawaz to finish with "outstanding" figures of 3-12 at the T20 World Cup final in Melbourne.

title: T20 World Cup: England's Adil Rashid gets 'massive wicket' of Babar Azam for 32
description: Watch as England's Adil Rashid takes the "massive wicket" of Pakistan captain Babar Azam for 32 at the T20 World Cup final in Melbourne.

title: T20 World Cup: Sam Curran bowls Mohammad Rizwan as England pick up first wicket
description: Watch as England's Sam Curran bowls Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan for 15 following an inside edge for the first wicket of the T20 World Cup final in Melbourne.

title: Man ends 20-year Llandegley airport sign prank that cost £25k
description: Nicolas Whitehead has decided to remove the sign for the fictitious airport with a large fanbase.

title: UFC 281: Alex Pereira knocks out Israel Adesanya to become champion
description: Alex Pereira knocks out Israel Adesanya to become middleweight champion at UFC 281.

title: M6 drivers outside Walsall face month-long overnight closures
description: The northbound carriageway will be closed from junction seven for Great Barr on weekdays.

title: England coach Simon Middleton says 'you never get over' losing Rugby World Cup final
description: England head coach Simon Middleton does not think he will "ever get over" losing a second successive Rugby World Cup final to New Zealand.

title: Switzerland migrant children demand immigration policy apology
description: Swiss migrant workers' children want an apology for a policy they say tore whole families apart.

title: US midterms: Democrats retain control of Senate after key Nevada victory
description: The results for Joe Biden's Democrats amount to the best midterm performance for a sitting party in 20 years.

title: Remembrance Sunday: UK to fall silent to commemorate war dead
description: Royalty, politicians and faith leaders will lay wreaths in a service at the Cenotaph in central London.

title: Have I dodged Covid and what does it mean?
description: Why have some people never had Covid and can that lead to better vaccines?

title: Tamil Nadu: The India couple who found love at mental health institute
description: Mahendran and Deepa tied the knot at the Institute of Mental Health in Chennai city last month.

title: Official Singles Chart turns 70: Seven historic controversies
description: The UK's singles chart turns 70 this week - but the countdown has not always gone smoothly.

title: Sao Paulo Grand Prix: George Russell pole a 'milestone' for Mercedes
description: George Russell says his victory in the Sao Paulo Grand Prix sprint race was a "milestone" for Mercedes - and that he and Lewis Hamilton would work together to try to repeat it in Sunday's grand prix.

title: Zimbabwe's dilemma over deadly elephant attacks
description: As the wildlife frontline becomes more dangerous, southern African nations want an end to the ivory ban.

title: Remembrance: Finding the faces of forgotten comrades
description: Brian Hough was only 18 when he fought in the Korean War but 70 years on he's trying to keep the memory of fallen soldiers alive.

title: MOTD Analysis: How 'magnificent' Brentford beat Manchester City
description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer tells fellow pundit Ian Wright and Gary Lineker how a "magnificent" Brentford outperformed Manchester City during their dramatic 2-1 win.
